result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian S Gourlay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ian S Gourlay in court with attorney Bruce A Fishbain.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
$150+cc, DNA surcharge waived, apply bond.
DNA condition of bond removed (per CC - does not apply to this offense as it occurred prior to April 1, 2015)
Status conference on June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim DL (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ian S Gourlay in court with attorney Bruce A Fishbain.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
